column4: hey guys im just wondering how do i install flash on firefox 3?
no adobe doesn't support linux.
What do you mean adobe doesnt support linux? For main apps you mean? You do know they have a linux flash plugin and adobe reader right?
What do you need?
adobe.com and go to flash and download the deb for flash. Its easy.
double click it and install
libnspr4-dev i get an error saying that is not a satisfiable dependancy
Lets keep it respectful here please.
Whats going on? errors with nvidia driver installation?
it's the entire "hardware drivers" thing in system>administration
any ideas??
Ok so are you getting this error while downloading from nvidia.com or during the actual driver install?
like i said it's the entire "hardware drivers" in system>administration>hardware drivers
Oh well just go around it and go to nvidia.com they have much newer driver there anyhow.
What do you mean it locks down your package archive folder?
I think apt-get puts packages in /var/cache/apt/archives as well.
hey man if you ever encounter people asking about ubuntu's backend problem let them know about sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-180 :)
Yeah new poeple might not know it but experienced user know that apt-get is pretty handy.
If you have a newer card the drivers from nvidia.com are much better BTW.
Debian comes with gnome out of the box
185 drivers much better then 180 or is there not much of a diffrence?
There newer. Better support for newer cards.
